contents.description: You will hear some conversations between two people. You will be asked to answer three questions about what the speakers say in each conversation. Select the best response to each question and mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet. The conversations will not be displayed on device and will be spoken only one time.

questions.title: Why is the woman calling?
questions.explain:
Why is the woman calling?
A. To make an appointment
B. To rent a car
C. To ask about a fee
D. To apply for a position
Information:
Hi. I got my car repaired last week and used your shuttle service to get a ride back to my office. Can you tell me why there's a service charge on my invoice for using the shuttle? I've never had to pay that before.

questions.title: According to the man, what has recently changed?
questions.explain:
According to the man, what has recently changed?
A. Office hours
B. Job requirements
C. A computer systems
D. A company policy
Information:
Yes, unfortunately the cost of auto fuel has risen quite a bit, so the company now requires us to charge for the shuttle.

questions.title: What does the man agree to do?
questions.explain:
What does the man agree to do?
A. Waive a fee
B. Reschedule a meeting
C. Sign a contract
D. Repair a vehicle

A. An annual upgrade
B. A money-back guarantee
C. A mobile phone application
D. A customer-service help line
Information:
And best of all, there's a mobile phone application that you can download for free.

questions.title: What does the speaker say has recently been announced?
answers: A new venue for an event
questions.explain:
What does the speaker say has recently been announced?
A. An increase in funding
B. A factory opening
C. A new venue for an event
D. A change in regulations
Information:
The announcement of new federal safety regulations means that major modifications must be made to the tracks.

questions.title: According to the speaker, why do some people dislike a construction project?
answers: Because it caused a power outage
questions.explain:
According to the speaker, why do some people dislike a construction project?
A. Because it caused a power outage
B. Because it costs too much
C. Because roads have been closed
D. Because of the loud noise
Information:
Some residents say they don't approve of how much money is being spent on the project

questions.title: What will the speaker do next?
questions.explain:
What will the speaker do next?
A. Introduce an advertiser
B. Attend a press conference
C. Interview some people
D. End a broadcast
Information:
I'll ask a few passersby how they feel about this latest development in the project

questions.title: What does the speaker thank the listeners for?
questions.explain:
What does the speaker thank the listeners for?< br>A. Reorganizing some files< br>B. Cleaning a work area< br>C. Working on a Saturday< br>D. Attending a training< br>Information:
Thanks for coming into the warehouse today to work on a Saturday.

questions.title: In which division do the listeners most likely work?
questions.explain:
In which division do the listeners most likely work?
A. Shipping and Receiving
B. Maintenance
C. Sales and Marketing
D. Accounting
Information:
There are hundreds of boxes, and we have to check what's inside them and put the information into our warehouse database.

questions.title: What does the speaker say he will provide?
questions.explain:
What does the speaker say he will provide?
A. A building name
B. Group numbers
C. Shift schedules
D. A temporary password
Information:
Now, I'm going to assign you all to groups. Once you have your group number, go ahead and join your group members.

questions.title: What event is being described?
questions.explain:
What event is being described?
A. A sports competition
B. A government ceremony
C. A music festival
D. A cooking contest
###
Information: And now, an event we've all been waiting for since last year - Danville's Annual Cook-Off.

questions.title: According to the speaker, what can the listeners find on a Web site?
questions.explain:
According to the speaker, what can the listeners find on a Web site?
A. A city map
B. A list of vendors
C. A demonstration video
D. An entry form
Information:
If you're interested in participating, the contest registration form is available on the city's Web site.

questions.title: Look at the graphic. Which day is the event being held?
questions.explain:
Look at the graphic. Which day is the event being held?
A. Saturday
B. Sunday
C. Monday
D. Tuesday
Information:
Now, keep in mind we're expecting a cloudy day for this year's event. (Sunday is cloudy)

questions.title: What is the purpose of the call ?
questions.explain:
What is the purpose of the call?
A. To confirm a deadline
B. To explain a company policy
C. To make a job offer
D. To discuss a new product
Information:
I'm calling because I'd like to hire you to discuss ways to make my company's database more secure.

questions.title: Look at the graphic. Who is the speaker calling?
questions.explain:
Look at the graphic. Who is the speaker calling?
A. Carla Wynn
B. Jae-Ho Kim
C. Kaori Aoki
D. Alex Lehmann
Information:
I'd like to hire you to discuss ways to make my company's database more secure. I know you specialize in this type of work.

questions.title: What does the speaker ask the listener to do?
questions.explain:
What does the speaker ask the listener to do?
A. Check a catalog
B. Send fee information
C. Submit a travel itinerary
D. Update a conference schedule
Information:
Could you please e-mail me a list of your consultant fees?

contents.description: In this part, a word or pharse is missing in each of the sentences below. Four answer choices are given below each sentence. Select the best answer to complete the sentence. Then mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet.

questions.title: Ms. Durkin asked for volunteers to help ____ with the employee fitness program
questions.explain:
Ms. Durkin asked for volunteers to help her with the employee fitness program.
A. She: Subject
B. Her: Object or Possessive Adjective (+N)
C. Hers: Possessive Pronoun
D. Herself: Reflexive Pronoun
Explanation: Help (V) + her (O)

questions.title: Lasner Electronics' staff have extensive ____ of current hardware systems
questions.explain:
Lasner Electronics staff have extensive knowledge of current hardware systems. A. Know: Verb B. Known: Past Participle C. Knowledge: Noun

D. Knowledgeable: Adjective Explanation: Extensive (Adj) + Knowledge (N) => Noun Phrase

questions.title: ____ a year, Tarrin Industrial Supply aud its the accounts of all of its factories
questions.explain:
Once a year, Tarrin Industrial Supply audits the accounts of all of its factories
A. Once + time (month, year...)
B. Immediately: without delay
C. Directly
D. Yet = but
Explanation:
"Once a year" makes sense, the others can stand alone.

questions.title: Ms. Pham requested a refund ____ the coffeemaker she received was damaged
questions.explain:
Ms. Pham requested a refund because the coffeemaker she received was damaged
A. despite + Ving/N
B. why: used in the question to ask
C. concerning +N
D. because +clause
Explanation:
Because is the conjunction to connect cause-effect clauses
Clause 1: Ms. Pham requested a refund
Clause 2: the coffeemaker she received was damaged

questions.title: Information ____ the artwork in the lobby is available at the reception desk
questions.explain:
Information about the artwork in the lobby is available at the reception desk
A. across
B. about
C. upon
D. except

questions.title: With the Gema XTI binoculars, users can ____ see objects that are more than 100 meters away
questions.explain:
With the Gema XTI binoculars, users can easily see objects that are more than 100 meters away
A. ease: Noun
B. easy: Adj
C. easily: Adv
D. easier: Comparative form
Explanation:
Users (N) + can + easily (Adv) + see (V)

questions.title: The Physical Therapy Association is committed to keeping costs ____ for its certification programs
questions.explain:
The Physical Therapy Association is committed to keeping costs affordable for its certification programs
A. affordable: cheap enough that people can afford to pay it or buy it
B. permitted = allowed
C. cutting
D. necessary: essential, vital

questions.title: Mr. Brennel ____ positions in various areas of the company before he became president
questions.explain:
Mr. Brennel occupied positions in various areas of the company before he became president
A. Occupation: Noun
B. Occupational: Adj
C. Occupying: Ving
D. Occupied: V (simple past)
Explanation:
Mr. Brennel (S) + occupied (V) + positions in various areas (O)

questions.title: To remain on schedule, editors must submit all ____ to the book to the authors by Friday
questions.explain:
To remain on schedule, editors must submit all revisions to the book to the authors by Friday
A. Ideas (of/about/for sth): a plan or thought, especially about what to do in a particular situation
B. Essays (on/about sth): a short piece of writing by a student as part of a course of study
C. Revisions (to sth): a change or set of changes to something
D. Suggestions (on/about sth):an idea or a plan that you mention for somebody else to think about

questions.title: ____ industry professionals are allowed to purchase tickets to the Kuo Photography Fair
questions.explain:
Only industry professionals are allowed to purchase tickets to the Kuo Photography Fair
A. only
B. until
C. unless
D. quite

questions.title: At Pharmbeck's banquet, Mr. Jones ____ a trophy for his performance in this year's quality-improvement initiative
questions.explain:
At Pharmbeck's banquet, Mr. Jones accepted a trophy for his performance in this year's quality-improvement initiative
A. accepted: to take willingly something that is offered
B. congratulated: to tell somebody that you are pleased about their success or achievements
C. nominated: to formally suggest that somebody/something should be chosen for an important role, prize, position
D. hoped: to want something to happen and think that it is possible

questions.title: Ms. Suto claims that important market trends become ____ with the use of data analysis
questions.explain:
Ms. Suto claims that important market trends become predictable with the use of data analysis
A. predict: Verb
B. prediction: Noun
C. predictable: Adj
D. predictably: Adv
Explanation:
become + Adj

questions.title: One of Grommer Consulting's goals is to enhance the relationship ____ salespeople and their customers
questions.explain:
One of Groomer Consulting's goals is to enhance the relationship between salespeople and their customers
A. inside
B. within
C. around
D. between
Explanation:
relationship between A and B

questions.title: Depending on your answers to the survey, we ____ you to collect additional information
questions.explain:
Depending on your answers to the survey, we may call you to collect additional information
A. may call
B. are calling
C. have been called
D. must be calling
Explanation:
"may" describes sth likely to happen

questions.title: ____ Jemburger opened its newest franchise, the first 100 customers were given free hamburgers
questions.explain:
When Jemburger opened its newest franchise, the first 100 customers were given free hamburgers
A. Now
B. When
C. As if
D. After all

questions.title: Please include the serial number of your product in any ____ with the customer service department
questions.explain:
Please include the serial number of your product in any correspondence with the customer service department
A. corresponds: Verb
B. correspondence: Noun
C. correspondingly: Adv
D. correspondent: Adj
Explanation:
Any + N (correspondence)

questions.title: The award-winning film UnderWater Secrets promotes awareness ____ ocean pollution and its effects on our planet
questions.explain:
The award-winning film UnderWater Secrets promotes awareness of ocean pollution and its effects on our planet
A. of
B. to
C. from
D. with
Explanation:
Collocation: awareness of sth

questions.title: BYF Company specializes in ____ promotional items to help companies advertise their brand
questions.explain:
BYF Company specializes in personalized promotional items to help companies advertise their brand
A. personally: Adv
B. personalized: Adj
C. personality: Noun
D. personalizes: Verb
Explanation:
The blank can be filled with an adj or an adv, but the adv "personally" is not suitable in this context

questions.title: ____ the rent increase is less than 2 percent, Selwin Electrical Supply will continue to lease the space
questions.explain:
As long as the rent increase is less than 2 percent, Selwin Electrical Supply will continue to lease the space
A. As long as + clause
B. Along with +N
C. Not only (... but also)
D. Otherwise + clause

questions.title: Belden Hospital's chief of staff meets regularly with the staff to ensure that procedures ____ correctly
questions.explain:
Belden Hospital's chief of staff meets regularly with the staff to ensure that procedures are being performed correctly
A. To be performed
B. would have performed: want to do but did not do
C. had been performed: done
D. are being performed: still going on
Explanation:
The action of performing the procedures are happening in the present

questions.title: Any requests for time off should be addressed to the ____ department supervisor
questions.explain:
Any requests for time off should be addressed to the appropriate department supervisor
A. urgent: that needs to be dealt with or happen immediately
B. appropriate: suitable
C. subsequent: happening or coming after something else
D. deliverable

questions.title: World Fish Supply delivers the freshest fish possible thanks to innovative ____ and shipping methods
questions.explain:
World Fish Supply delivers the freshest fish possible thanks to innovative preservation and shipping methods
A. preserves: V (present simple)
B. preserved: V (past simple)
C. preserve: V-infinitive
D. preservation: Noun
Explanation:
Thanks to + Noun

questions.title: Company executives are currently reviewing the annual budget ____ submitted to them by the Financial Planning department
questions.explain:
Company executives are currently reviewing the annual budget requirements submitted to them by the Financial Planning department
A. requirements
B. deliveries
C. developers
D. qualities

questions.title: Even the CEO had to admit that Prasma Designs' win was ____ the result of fortunate timing
questions.explain:
Even the CEO had to admit that Prasma Designs' win was partly the result of fortunate timing
A. part: Noun
B. parted: Adj
C. partly: Adv
D. parting: Noun (the act or occasion of leaving a person or place)

questions.title: Mr. Singh took notes on ____ the focus group discussed during the morning session
questions.explain:
Mr. Singh took notes on everything the focus group discussed during the morning session
A. each + singular N
B. several + plural N
C. another + singular N
D. everything

questions.title: Tiu  ca cu hi th 6
questions.explain: Gii thch cho cu th 6

questions.title: Tiu  ca cu hi th 7
questions.explain: Gii thch cho cu th 7

questions.title: Tiu  ca cu hi th 8
questions.explain: Gii thch cho cu th 8

questions.title: Tiu  ca cu hi th 9
questions.explain: Gii thch cho cu th 9

questions.title: Tiu  ca cu hi th 10
questions.explain: Gii thch cho cu th 7
